meanings.definition: The state or quality of being intransitive.
meanings.sent1: The intransitiveness of the verb 'sleep' means it does not need a direct object.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the intransitiveness of verbs in my grammar class.
meanings.sent3: The intransitiveness of the word 'swim' made it the easiest verb to conjugate.
meanings.sent4: Her intransitiveness in conversation made her a great listener.
meanings.sent5: The intransitiveness of the sentence confused the students.

meanings.definition: The property of a verb that does not require a direct object to complete its meaning.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the intransitiveness of the verb 'cry' helped me with sentence structure.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of intransitiveness using the verb 'run'.
meanings.sent3: The intransitiveness of the word 'laugh' made it a fun verb to use in sentences.
meanings.sent4: His intransitiveness in speech allowed him to express himself freely.
meanings.sent5: The intransitiveness of the action made it stand out in the story.
